p: In a research, Al‐Ankari, Zaki and Al‐Sutan found that supplementation of Mentha piperita at the level of 1.5% for 35 days showed beneficial results on body weight, feed intake and FCR in broilers (Al‐Ankari, Zaki, & Al‐Sutan, 2004). Similarly, Nobakht, Norany & Safamehr reported that feeding 0.5% dried Mentha pulegium resulted in positive effects on performance in broilers at 42 days of age (Nobakht, Norany, & Safamehr, 2011). Whereas, Ocak et al. reported that supplemental Mentha piperita (0.2%) had no effects on broilers body weight and FCR at 42 days of age (Ocak et al., 2008). The controversy among these studies might be due to the differences in mint resources, which vary according to species, active ingredient, harvest time, etc (Brenes & Roura, 2010).
